keyword: how many calories in a sushi roll
title: How Many Calories in a Sushi Roll?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a sushi roll, including macros like carbs, protein, and fat, plus variations and FAQs for better choices.
h1: How Many Calories in a Sushi Roll?
assumptions: Standard California roll (imitation crab, avocado, cucumber, seasoned rice, nori; ~8 pieces or 200-250 g total).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type, ingredients, rice portion, and preparation; restaurant vs. homemade differs. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical California sushi roll has about 255 kcal, with high carbs from rice and moderate protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a California sushi roll?
faqs.a: About 255 kcal for a standard 8-piece roll.

faqs.q: Are sushi rolls high in carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, mostly from rice—around 38 g carbs per roll.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in a sushi roll?
faqs.a: Typically 630 mg, from soy sauce and seasonings.

faqs.q: What's lower calorie: tempura or regular roll?
faqs.a: Regular rolls like California are lower (~255 kcal) vs. tempura (~400+ kcal).

faqs.q: Do all sushi rolls have the same calories?
faqs.a: No—varies by fillings; salmon rolls ~300 kcal, veggie ~150 kcal.
